questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'extends' keyword in Java?
options: To create a new class that is a subclass of an existing class.
To include external libraries in a Java program.
To declare a variable.
To declare a method as extended.
questions.answer: To create a new class that is a subclass of an existing class.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about method overriding?
options: It allows a subclass to replace the implementation of a method defined in its superclass.
It must change the method signature.
It is used to increase the visibility of a method in a subclass.
It cannot be done in Java.
questions.answer: It allows a subclass to replace the implementation of a method defined in its superclass.

questions.question: What is polymorphism?
options: Changing the form of a method based on the input parameters.
The ability of a variable, function or object to take on multiple forms.
The division of a program into multiple classes.
The process of using loops.
questions.answer: The ability of a variable, function or object to take on multiple forms.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about abstract classes is TRUE?
options: You can create instances of an abstract class.
Abstract classes can only contain abstract methods.
Abstract classes are used to provide a base for subclasses to extend, but cannot be instantiated.
Abstract classes are fully implemented classes and cannot be extended.
questions.answer: Abstract classes are used to provide a base for subclasses to extend, but cannot be instantiated.

questions.question: What is the 'super' keyword used for?
options: To call a method of the superclass from within an overriding method in a subclass.
To declare a variable in the superclass.
To increase the visibility of a superclass method.
To declare a superclass as superior.
questions.answer: To call a method of the superclass from within an overriding method in a subclass.
